dfischer.proxysniffer

Class ProxyRecorderPluginURLContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.proxysniffer.ProxyRecorderPluginURLContext

  • public class ProxyRecorderPluginURLContext
extends java.lang.Object
    A context which is created by the proxy recorder foreach URL call - used by recorder plug-ins.
    See Also:
    ProxyRecorderPluginInterface

      • setFailureException

        public void setFailureException(java.lang.Exception failureException)
        Mark that the URL call to the web server has failed. Note that this can only happen if ProxyRecorderSettings.setRecordFailedTransmitRequests(<boolean>) is set to true.
        Parameters:
        failureException - the exception of the failed URL call
        Since:
        V5.2-U
        See Also:
        ProxyRecorderSettings.setRecordFailedTransmitRequests(boolean)

      • getRecorderSequenceID

        public int getRecorderSequenceID()
        Get the recorder sequence ID set at the time before the URL call was sent to the web server. An older recoding sequence ID may be returned by this method when reset/clear recording was called after the HTTP request was sent to the web server, but before the HTTP response was received from the web server. You may compare the returned sequence ID of this method with the actual sequence ID of the recorder. Note that the sequence ID is reset when the recorder process is restarted.
        Returns:
        the recorder sequence ID set at the time before the URL call was sent to the web server
        Since:
        V5.2-U
        See Also:
        ProxyRecorderContext.getRecorderSequenceID(), PrxControl.clearRecording()

      • getHttpRequest

        public HttpRequest getHttpRequest()
        Get the HTTP request of the URL call.
        Returns:
        the HTTP request of the URL call

      • getHttpResponse

        public HttpResponse getHttpResponse()
        Get the HTTP response of the URL call.
        Returns:
        the HTTP response of the URL call, or null if no such data are available

      • getWebSocketData

        public dfischer.proxysniffer.WebSocketData getWebSocketData()
        Get the Web Socket data of the URL call.
        Returns:

      • getRecordData

        public ProxyDataRecord getRecordData()
        Get the recorded data of the URL call.
        Returns:
        the recorded data of the URL call, or null if no such data are available
        See Also:
        ProxyRecorderContext.getRecordState(), ProxyRecorderContext.getRecordVector()

      • getRequestResponseContext

        public java.lang.Object getRequestResponseContext()
        Get the context used by the plug-in.
        Returns:
        the context used by the plug-in, or null if no such data are available

      • getExecutionStep

        public int getExecutionStep()
        Get the execution step of the URL call when the URL call to the web server has failed. Note that recorder plug-ins are normally not notified if an URL call fails (standard behaviour). But when ProxyRecorderSettings.setRecordFailedTransmitRequests(<boolean>) is set to true then the recorder plug-ins are notified. The method getHttpResponse() may return null in such a case.
        Returns:
        the execution step of the URL call when the URL call to the web server has failed
        Since:
        V5.2-U
        See Also:
        ProxyDataRecord.STEP_NOSTEP, ProxyDataRecord.STEP_DNS_RESOLVE, ProxyDataRecord.STEP_OPEN_CONNECTION, ProxyDataRecord.STEP_SSL_HANDSHAKE, ProxyDataRecord.STEP_TRANSMIT_REQUEST, ProxyDataRecord.STEP_RECEIVE_RESPONSE, ProxyDataRecord.STEP_ALL_DONE

      • getFailureException

        public java.lang.Exception getFailureException()
        Get the exception in case when the URL call to the web server has failed. Note that recorder plug-ins are normally not notified if an URL call fails (standard behaviour). But when ProxyRecorderSettings.setRecordFailedTransmitRequests(<boolean>) is set to true then the recorder plug-ins are notified. The method getHttpResponse() may return null in such a case.
        Returns:
        the exception of the failed URL call, or null if the URL call was successful.
        Since:
        V5.2-U
        See Also:
        getHttpResponse(), ProxyRecorderSettings.setRecordFailedTransmitRequests(boolean)
